body:
Can you please provide more information? Are you running your application in dev mode?
Do you have a module which runs a query against the database?

Yes, I'm running in DEV mode:
`[FiLe-App] $ run -Dhttp.port=9000 -Dhttps.port=9443`
with
`play.evolutions.autoApply=false`
in application.conf.

I've restarted my app with
`play.evolutions.autoApply=true`
and Play succeeded in evolving the database.

So there is a workaround.
Do you have any modules that access the database?

Thanks for having edited my comment from before, @mkurz !

I'll try to remember to do so myself in the future.

Hmm... after looking at the exception log maybe this is not releated to evolutions...
```
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: key not found: Id

at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:101)
at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:99)
at play.api.libs.typedmap.DefaultTypedMap.apply(TypedMap.scala:102)
at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id(RequestHeader.scala:35)
at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id$(RequestHeader.scala:35)
at play.api.mvc.RequestHeaderImpl.id(RequestHeader.scala:352)
at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:172)
at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext$(JavaHelpers.scala:169)
at play.core.j.JavaHelpers$.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:282)
at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.withContext(JavaHelpers.scala:270)
```

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/cc8eacf3d6fe40fb8c91e692eef0729b852101a8/framework/src/play/src/main/scala/play/core/j/JavaHelpers.scala#L172

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/cc8eacf3d6fe40fb8c91e692eef0729b852101a8/framework/src/play/src/main/scala/play/api/mvc/RequestHeader.scala#L35

Looks like there wasn't a request id...

@Squeng Please stop your application, remove the `target` folder and try again. Does it still happen?

# first
I've re-set application.conf to say
`play.evolutions.autoApply=false`
(Note that I originally got it wrong in https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/8947#issuecomment-454391584)

I've added another SQL script:
```sql
# following up on https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/8947


# --- !Ups

ALTER TABLE Users ADD debugging bit;


# --- !Downs

ALTER TABLE Users DROP debugging;
```

Play 2.7.0-RC9 is back to failing:
```
play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$$anon$1: Execution exception[[NoSuchElementException: key not found: Id]]
        at play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$.throwableToUsefulException(HttpErrorHandler.scala:323)
        at play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler.onServerError(HttpErrorHandler.scala:243)
        at play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler$.onServerError(HttpErrorHandler.scala:464)
        at play.core.server.Server$$anonfun$handleErrors$1$1.applyOrElse(Server.scala:96)
        at play.core.server.Server$$anonfun$handleErrors$1$1.applyOrElse(Server.scala:92)
        at scala.runtime.AbstractPartialFunction.apply(AbstractPartialFunction.scala:38)
        at play.core.server.Server$.getHandlerFor(Server.scala:115)
        at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer.handleRequest(AkkaHttpServer.scala:267)
        at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer.$anonfun$createServerBinding$1(AkkaHttpServer.scala:149)
        at akka.stream.impl.fusing.MapAsync$$anon$30.onPush(Ops.scala:1207)
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: key not found: Id
        at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:101)
        at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:99)
        at play.api.libs.typedmap.DefaultTypedMap.apply(TypedMap.scala:102)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id(RequestHeader.scala:35)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id$(RequestHeader.scala:35)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeaderImpl.id(RequestHeader.scala:352)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:172)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext$(JavaHelpers.scala:169)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers$.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:282)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.withContext(JavaHelpers.scala:270)
```

# second
I've stopped the app (and exited the sbt console) and then removed the `target` folder as requested by https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/8947#issuecomment-454393874

# third
I've re-entered the sbt console (which resulted in a new `target` folder) and re-started the app.
It still fails with the exception above.

# fourth
I've deleted the new SQL script from both the `conf\evolutions\default` folder as well as within `target` and reloaded the page.
Everything is back to normal (i.e., the app is up & running).
@Squeng would it be possible to provide us a test project so we can test ourselves? You could remove all stuff that is not relevant for this issue here, and upload to GitHub?

@mkurz After having stripped the project of all that seemed irrelevant, Evolutions are working ...

I'll have to re-strip the project less aggressively; maybe I can figure out what the tipping point is.
Interesting. Let us know what you find out along the way.
Alright, can you debug which `if` branch is called and also again post the *whole* exception? Thanks!
I mean the `onNotFound` in your error handler will even be called or not?

Can you post your whole `logback.xml`?

Also can you remove your `logback.xml` and try again?

Deleting `logback.xml`didn't do the trick:
```
[error] application -

! @7ahpn0ln6 - Internal server error, for (GET) [/] ->

play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$$anon$1: Execution exception[[NoSuchElementException: key not found: Id]]
        at play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$.throwableToUsefulException(HttpErrorHandler.scala:323)
        at play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler.onServerError(HttpErrorHandler.scala:243)
        at play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler$.onServerError(HttpErrorHandler.scala:464)
        at play.core.server.Server$$anonfun$handleErrors$1$1.applyOrElse(Server.scala:96)
        at play.core.server.Server$$anonfun$handleErrors$1$1.applyOrElse(Server.scala:92)
        at scala.runtime.AbstractPartialFunction.apply(AbstractPartialFunction.scala:38)
        at play.core.server.Server$.getHandlerFor(Server.scala:115)
        at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer.handleRequest(AkkaHttpServer.scala:267)
        at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer.$anonfun$createServerBinding$1(AkkaHttpServer.scala:149)
        at akka.stream.impl.fusing.MapAsync$$anon$30.onPush(Ops.scala:1207)
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: key not found: Id
        at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:101)
        at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:99)
        at play.api.libs.typedmap.DefaultTypedMap.apply(TypedMap.scala:102)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id(RequestHeader.scala:35)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id$(RequestHeader.scala:35)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeaderImpl.id(RequestHeader.scala:352)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:172)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext$(JavaHelpers.scala:169)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers$.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:282)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.withContext(JavaHelpers.scala:270)
````

Anyway, it looks as follows:
```xml
<!-- https://www.playframework.com/documentation/latest/SettingsLogger -->
<configuration>

  <conversionRule conversionWord="coloredLevel" converterClass="play.api.libs.logback.ColoredLevel" />

  <appender name="FILE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.FileAppender">
    <file>${application.home:-.}/logs/application.log</file>
    <encoder>
      <pattern>%date [%level] from %logger in %thread - %message%n%xException</pattern>
    </encoder>
  </appender>

  <appender name="STDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
    <encoder>
      <pattern>%n%coloredLevel %message%n%date{ISO8601} | LogLevel = %p | ServiceID = FiLe | Version = %X{AppVersion} | Environment = ${ixSplunk.Environment} | HostName = ${ixSplunk.HostName} | Subsystem = %class | Thread = %t | LogTrackingID = %X{LogTrackingID} | LogUserID = %X{LogUserID} | LogRequestID = %X{LogRequestID} | Message = %message%n%xException{10}</pattern>
    </encoder>
  </appender>

  <appender name="PROBE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
    <encoder>
      <pattern>%n%coloredLevel %message%n%date{ISO8601} | LogLevel = PROBE | ServiceID = FiLe | Version = %X{AppVersion} | Environment = ${ixSplunk.Environment} | HostName = ${ixSplunk.HostName} | Subsystem = %class | Thread = %t | LogTrackingID = %X{LogTrackingID} | LogUserID = %X{LogUserID} | LogRequestID = %X{LogRequestID} | CallPayload = %X{CallPayload} | CallTo = %X{CallTo} | CallFrom = %X{CallFrom} | CallHeader = %X{CallHeader} | Message = %message%n%xException{10}</pattern>
    </encoder>
  </appender>

  <appender name="ASYNCFILE" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
    <appender-ref ref="FILE" />
  </appender>

  <appender name="ASYNCSTDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
    <appender-ref ref="STDOUT" />
    <includeCallerData>true</includeCallerData>
  </appender>

  <appender name="ASYNCPROBE" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
    <appender-ref ref="PROBE" />
  </appender>

  <logger name="play" level="INFO" />
  <logger name="application" level="DEBUG" />
  <logger name="prober" level="INFO" additivity="false">
    <appender-ref ref="ASYNCPROBE" />
  </logger>

  <!-- Off these ones as they are annoying, and anyway we manage configuration ourselves -->
  <logger name="com.avaje.ebean.config.PropertyMapLoader" level="OFF" />
  <logger name="com.avaje.ebeaninternal.server.core.XmlConfigLoader" level="OFF" />
  <logger name="com.avaje.ebeaninternal.server.lib.BackgroundThread" level="OFF" />
  <logger name="com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript" level="OFF" />

  <root level="WARN">
    <appender-ref ref="ASYNCFILE" />
    <appender-ref ref="ASYNCSTDOUT" />
  </root>

</configuration>
```
Alright, would it be possible that you upload your project to GitHub or provide it via a zip or gz file so I can debug myself?

- cf. https://github.com/Squeng/Playverderber
- `PS C:\Users\Paul\Desktop\Playverderber> sbt`
- `[FiLe-App] $ h2-browser`-> JDBC url "jdbc:h2:~/FiLe-App", user "sa", password "123" -> note the empty DB (no PLAY_EVOLUTIONS table yet)
- `[FiLe-App] $ run -Dhttp.port=9000 -Dhttps.port=9443` and open https://localhost:9443/filewaf/bankers (accepting the Play-generated certificate)
- "Database 'default' needs evolution!" -> "Apply this script now!" => note the updated DB schema
- move `2.sql` from `public` to `conf\evolutions\default` and `ErrorHandler.java` to `app`
- re-open https://localhost:9443/filewaf/bankers
Et voil:
```
[error]

! @7ai5a0k65 - Internal server error, for (GET) [/filewaf/bankers] ->

2019-01-17 14:33:48,081 | LogLevel = ERROR | ServiceID = FiLe | Version =  | Environment = DEV-Lieferant | HostName = LocalHost | Subsystem = play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler | Thread = play-dev-mode-akka.actor.default-dispatcher-56 | LogTrackingID =  | LogUserID =  | LogRequestID =  | Message =

! @7ai5a0k65 - Internal server error, for (GET) [/filewaf/bankers] ->

play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$$anon$1: Execution exception[[NoSuchElementException: key not found: Id]]
        at play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$.throwableToUsefulException(HttpErrorHandler.scala:323)
        at play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler.onServerError(HttpErrorHandler.scala:243)
        at play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler$.onServerError(HttpErrorHandler.scala:464)
        at play.core.server.Server$$anonfun$handleErrors$1$1.applyOrElse(Server.scala:96)
        at play.core.server.Server$$anonfun$handleErrors$1$1.applyOrElse(Server.scala:92)
        at scala.runtime.AbstractPartialFunction.apply(AbstractPartialFunction.scala:38)
        at play.core.server.Server$.getHandlerFor(Server.scala:115)
        at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer.handleRequest(AkkaHttpServer.scala:267)
        at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer.$anonfun$createServerBinding$1(AkkaHttpServer.scala:149)
        at akka.stream.impl.fusing.MapAsync$$anon$30.onPush(Ops.scala:1207)
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: key not found: Id
        at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:101)
        at scala.collection.immutable.Map$EmptyMap$.apply(Map.scala:99)
        at play.api.libs.typedmap.DefaultTypedMap.apply(TypedMap.scala:102)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id(RequestHeader.scala:35)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeader.id$(RequestHeader.scala:35)
        at play.api.mvc.RequestHeaderImpl.id(RequestHeader.scala:352)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:172)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.createJavaContext$(JavaHelpers.scala:169)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers$.createJavaContext(JavaHelpers.scala:282)
        at play.core.j.JavaHelpers.withContext(JavaHelpers.scala:270)
```
